title: Internal 500 Error
content:
Everytime, and probably even here shortly, I get the Internal Server 500 error. What is up with that?   
   
I'm IE 5.x on a mac.
author: markatos

comments.content: Peter I use Mozilla, never had a problem, I'm on a G4 mac. Dan

Peter, I have the same IE 5.x on a mac as you and I don't have any problems.   
Sorry I can not help any futher.   
   
gln
I usually post with IE6/PC and I get internal server errors probably 80% of the time when attempting to post.
FYI, the preview function takes apprximately 3 seconds to process, while the post function can take upwards of 40 seconds.

I get the same problem with the delay, even though I have a   
fast connection. I get the 500 error once in a while. The   
script that runs Typophile seems to have trouble sending   
back the updated page with your post appended, but not   
storing the post. If you get the error, go back to the page   
you posted to and see if it's there. Most likely it will be. If   
you are worried that you might lose your post, copy it to   
the clipboard before hitting the "post this message" button.

Yeah, my post always goes up, but I always get the 500 error. Is there a sys admin that is aware of this?   
   
Not a big deal, just a minor nuisance.
